intro: Hymenolobus procumbens subsp. revelierei, commonly known as the dwarf sandverbena, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white to pale blue flowers. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a compact growth habit, with stems that typically remain close to the ground. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant.
